headline: Avocado Shrimp Ceviche-Estillo Sarita
description: Shrimp is marinated in lime juice, then mixed with tomato, cilantro, avocado, onion and a special sauce.

video.description: Watch how to make this tried-and-true recipe.
video.name: Avocado Shrimp Ceviche-Estillo Sarita

name: Avocado Shrimp Ceviche-Estillo Sarita
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds large shrimp - peeled, deveined and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Place the shrimp and lime juice into a large bowl, and stir to coat. Let stand for about 5 minutes, or until shrimp are opaque. The lime juice will cook them. Mix in the tomatoes, onion, and cilantro until coated with lime juice; cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.

Remove from the refrigerator, and mix in the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, hot sauce, salt and pepper. We have our own hot sauce recipe, but you can use whatever hot sauce you like, or leave it out and let people add their own when serving.
Serve in glass tumblers and top with avocado pieces. Set out extra Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, lime wedges and hot sauce for people to individualize their dish. Serve with saltine crackers.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe and have made it several times to rave reviews from family and friends. The only modification I'd recommend is to let the shrimp sit for several hours in the lime juice or just use cooked shrimp (which doesn't seem to affect the results). The first time I made it as written, the shrimp was a bit raw. Also, if you like things a little spicy like me, adding minced garlic and chopped jalapeno to taste works well.
Loved it! Gone in no time! Cant wait to make it again!!!!
Excellent! Added the Worchestershire sauce, salt and pepper and let it cook overnight. I added a dash of cumin too, just because.

Have made this twice. I use wild caught shrimp already cooked and still marinate in lime juice for the stated amount of time or over night. Family like spicy, so I tweak the sauce; 2Tbs Ketchup, 2Tbs Worcestershire, 1Tbs Sriracha, 2Tbs Tapatío & 1Tbs liet soy sauce (yeah, yeah). I also double the Romas and use a whole head of Cilantro. Must use fresh ground pepper and either sea salt or fresh ground pink himalayan. Awesome!

My first time eating this and it was delicious! I didn't know you could cook shrimp in fresh lime juice, so I learned something new too. My son and daughter in law were here, their Hispanic friends make this all the time and they said this recipe stacks up along side the best. We ate too much and then had dinner and birthday cake with ice cream. Perfect family Sunday!

Didn’t add the avocado on this picture. I still had it marinating but so far it taste delicious. Added jalapeños for a little kick. Tomorrow for lunch I will add some of the crab meat that I have. I appreciate the recipe!

The taste is great, but the shrimp was in the lime juice too long and "overcooked". Maybe 30 mins would have been better. My only change was using green onions instead of regular ones because I was out and adding orange peppers.
Easy to make!! I’ve made this several times and each time it’s a crowd pleaser. I highly recommend

Easy and very flavorful ceviche. I rough chopped already cooked shrimp and Persian cucumbers. I also added mango for an interesting sweet note and Yuzu Hot Sauce for a little more kick and citrus notes. I would usually use a cocktail sauce for more kick but I made the sauce with ketchup per the recipe and I found I liked the bit of sweetness it added as it married well with the mango . It was a big hit at my event.
Came out great as is. Everyone that I told I was making it had advice on how to kick it up a little. I can’t wait to try it again adding avocado and some Bass
awesome

I followed the recipe exactly, and it was the best ceviche I've ever had. I diced everything on the small side, like our local restaurant does, and served it with saltines. By the way, I do wish some of you reviewers would acknowledge that yours is not the only authentic way. So what if you grew up in Mexico and never ate it with saltines? Our local chef grew up in Mexico and ALWAYS had it with saltines. That doesn't make you right or him wrong. But no matter how you eat it, this recipe is the best!
To give this receipe some extra ump, I substituted the Roma tomatoes, onions, and the hot sauce with 2 large containers of Kroger Pico that contained diced jalapenos.
Excellent recipe. I did sub out 1/4 cup clamato juice for the ketchup (just don't like ketchup). Turned out delicious with store bought tostadas.

Do not try eating these if you follow the directions exactly as stated unless you want to end up sick to your stomach. The shrimp will not cook in the lime in 5 minutes. That just does not happen. However, I set them to "cook" in the lime overnight and they were perfect. I'm not a huge fan of saltines, so I used Tostitos instead and it was delicious.

Made this recipe a few times now. Each time everyone loves it. I add a minced jalapeño to add a bit of kick.
Thanks for the recipe.
Didn't change a thing, it was fantastic!
Delish
I had to sub Coconut Aminos for Worchestershire sauce due to a soy allergy, but this turned out nice and palatable. I'm sure with practice I could get it restaurant quality!
I made this recipe exactly as it was and it was great! I will definitely make it again!
My husband said this is the best thing ever. Did not use crackers but chips instead!

Totally loved this! I chopped the shrimp to about 1/4" chunks and tossed with all the other ingredients in a bowl and covered it like you would pudding with plastic wrap and plopped it in the fridge for the night. I stirred it a couple of times and yes, it took a little while to cook. I had to alter for ingredients I thought I had....so used cocktail sauce for the ketchup and Worcestershire, and finely minced jalapeno for a spice because, sadly, no hot sauce. I added a bit of chopped English cucumber because I had it. Well worth the wait! I live in South Texas and I have always had ceviche served with tortilla chips, so that's what I did. I would make this again!!!

So simple! A couple adjustments made- 1) I chopped up the large shrimp into dime sized pieces before adding it to the ziplock bag of lime juice, which really helped in reducing the amount of shrimp required. 2) I didn’t buy enough Roma tomatoes for both the guacamole and ceviche I was making, but discovered you can substitute a can of diced tomatoes and forego the ketchup just fine! 3) I used buffalo wing sauce for the hot sauce (I forgot to pickup hot sauce at the store) and it worked out great! I made about a gallon for our boat dock Cinco De Mayo potluck and this was a hit! So easy to make the day before and allow the flavors to set in!

Terrible. DO NOT USE. You must parboil your shrimp before anything, otherwise you'll be waiting until next year for the lime juice to cook your shrimp and by then they'll re terrible. Glad I ruined two pounds of good fresh shrimp following this recipe.

This is a great go to recipe that my family loves. I did a few things different though. I omitted the ketchup and used cocktail sauce in its place. We used red onion instead of white to give it some color. We also added garlic salt and some lawry's season salt. We serve it with chips. Its a great recipe!
This was a hit at work. I used jalapeño ketchup and Tapatio sauce. I added extra jalapeños and cilantro for more crisp flavor.

Super easy and very tasty. Just ensure you dice up the veggies small and chop the shrimp or fish up in small pieces, this will allow it to cook in the lime juice faster. I will be making this again soon.
This was amazing!!!

Holy moly, was this amazing!
I've never made ceviche at home before but had recently tried it at a party and knew it was time for me to try :)
This recipe is wonderful with the perfect blend of ingredients. I followed it almost exactly (except I took one reviewers advice of letting the shrimp marinate/cook in the lime juice for 30 mins before adding the other veggies. I also added some jicama (because I had it on hand) and topped the final product with avocado (because AVOCADO!!) 
I highly recommend this recipe, you won't be sorry!

This is really pretty delicious! I used to make ceviche with just the standard ingredients of pico de gallo and added whatever fish I felt like. I always thought something was missing with that. I never thought to add worschestershire sauce and ketchup but that was definitely what my recipe needed! I also add a few shakes of tapatio:) recently moved down to Florida and now that fresh seafood and fresh produce is readily available and cheap, ceviche has become a staple! Especially with the upcoming warm weather :)
Excellent, I had a lot of compliments.
VERY good! All my guest thoroughly enjoyed it. Can you say "GONE"!!

LOVED this recipe! It was a major hit! The only changes I made were: 

1. I "cooked" the shrimp in lime juice overnight
2. I used cocktail sauce instead of ketchup 
3. I added one canned jalapeno pepper

I divided in half so could have 1/2 original and 1/2 with 1 mango as needed to get used up. my friends liked better than I did, but in all fairness I didn't add salt or pepper as have to watch salt intake, friends did add and said was much better.
I love this recipe. I also use tangerine juice and chopped Manzanillo olives. So delicious.
Very good, light citrus. Perfect on hot summer day. I did add 1 jalapeño to kick it up a notch.

Made ceviche for the first time today using this recipe as a guideline. I didn't have any cooking of my fresh, raw shrimp issues in the lime/lemon juice (I used half of each). I did add some minced garlic, 1 diced Serrano chile, diced cucumber & shredded carrot. Everything looked fine and tasted delicious until I added the Worcestershire sauce. It turned the juice to a light brownish color that I didn't like. It didn't look fresh & appetizing any longer. I tasted it before adding and it was fine so next time I will leave it out only because of the color appearance. I made it a day ahead to insure shrimp was cooked and veggies marinated in the yummy liquid. Very tasty and will definitely make again. Oh, I did finely chop avocados (2) and added to ceviche.
I didn't let the lime juice cook the shrimp. I cooked it, but other than that it was amazing!

i made this just as it was written. it took about 20 minutes for the the shrimp to turn opaque for me, but 20 minutes in the juice out of the fridge plus another hour in was perfect. i also drained most of the lime juice after i took it out of the fridge. it was delicious. this was my wife's first time eating ceviche. she let out an audible moan and exclaimed wow after eating it.
Excellent. Even when you forget the avacados. DOH!
first time ever making ceviche and it was great!! never knew it was such an easy dish to make
Always a crowd pleaser! I make it all the time and there's never wasted left overs.

Very delicious! As mentioned in other reviews, the shrimp did not become opaque in an hour. I would recommend steaming them for a couple minutes chill then add them to the lime juice. I instead let them sit in the lime juice for 3 hours and then went on with the instructions. Love ceviche especially with avocado!
So easy to make. Low calorie (if you don't eat with homemade chips) LOL
This is very tasty. So glad I found this recipe!

Delicious! One of my new fav healthy go to meals/snacks. Followed the recipe, but added a little chile powder, cumin, cayenne pepper and a dash of sriracha...yes sriracha! Smeared avocado on a tostada and added the ceviche on top. Talk about a perfectly spicy, refreshing, and filling dish!

Thanks for sharing this gem.
WAY too much for 4 servings. Plus, lime juice did not cook the shrimp. Taste wasn't all that great either.
Really liked it! I did use purple onions instead and chopped everything a little smaller, but that's how I like it.

As always, before trying a recipe - I read reviews first to get suggestions. I followed recipe as written, but our stores didn't have large shrimp so got the largest we did have. Cut them into bite-size pieces, put the lime juice on them (about 1 cup juice) and they "cooked" in about 30 minutes. Added the tomatoes, 1 full white onion, 2 bunches of cilantro (as we love it)! Then comes the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, salt, pepper, and hot sauce (added much more as we love spicy) ! Added avocado pieces directly to this mixture, stirred and put back in to chill ! So good! Served as a salad and added crumbled Feta cheese before serving.
Easy and delicious!
This was so delicious! Had it for lunch with my honey! It was a,mazing! Added a little more cilantro and finely chopped Serrano pepper. Will definetly make it again.

I made this very quickly so I didn't do a good job if reading the recipe and chopped my avocado along with everything else...but it tasted great. I too used cooked shrimp bc my kids were eating it. I wanted it as a light dinner and not an appetizer so I put I over lettuce for some and made lettuce wraps for others. Very easy but time consuming to chop everything.

The added flavor (ketchup, Worcestershire, hot sauce) really makes this dish spectacular. I cut my shrimp a little too large and the centers of the large pieces were still raw after 30 minutes so I added the juice of one lemon and that did the trick.

This was a good recipe! I am giving it a 4 because my husband loved it. I felt that something was missing in the taste. After reading some previous reviews I used pre-cooked shrimp instead of raw. Overall it was very good! I served it in a frozen martini glass and it looked amazing!!!
This turned out wonderful!! I had never made ceviche and I am so happy I tried this out.
Ceviche was marinated in lime juice and instead of 1 Tbsp. Ketchup, i use 2 1/2 cups Clamato Juice.
I just tried it! It is good
Loved it! Gone in no time! Cant wait to make it again!!!!
I made this tonight and my family loved it. So delicious!

Loved this recipe and so did everyone at my party! This is how I will make Ceviche from now on. I used half shrimp, half imitation crab (both fully cooked) and doubled the cilantro (everyone loves cilantro don't they?) I served it with Tostitos scoops as an appetizer. Thank you!!!

I like to prepare things in advance so when guests come I can just serve. This dish is great for that. I did cook the shrimp in boiling water for a min. till it turned pink and curled and then quickly added it to cold water to stop the cooking. Day 1 I cleaned the shrimp, and added the lime juice, tomatoes, onion, and cilantro. I think 1/2 or 3/4 of the onion is good, the whole onion is a little too much. refrigerate overnight.
Day 2 I added the worcestershire sauce, ketchup, hot sauce, & S/P. Back in fridge.
Day 3 just cut up avocado and added it to mix poured shrimp in festive glasses and added a lime wedge what a hit! Delicious!
Very yummy!!! I made this and followed the recipe exactly! Will make again!!
I use this recipe as a jumping off point- I use snapper instead of shrimp and add a cucumber and a red pepper (for crunch) It's a hit!

Like others I cheated and used the already cooked shrimp due to time constraints. The lime seemed to further cook the shrimp and it was tough in texture. I am only giving 3 stars because although the recipe is easy enough to follow, it was time consuming and just wan't to my taste. Visually appealing no doubt. May try one more time with raw shrimp.

My SIL made this as an appetizer for Xmas. If you like guacamole, you will LOVE this. Im not a cold shrimp eating person but the flavors come together so well in this recipe that you cant help hoard the bowl to yourself! I would have never thought to add the sauces to something like this as well. I have now made this part of my recipes so I can make it for myself. Well done!

This was really good! I had the same problem as others with the shrimp not cooking fully in an hour, so I took the whole thing and simmered it for about a minute. This fixed the problem. Maybe if you let the shrimp sit overnight like others suggested, the shrimp would cook through. The flavor was nice, though!

Soooo good! I made it as written except I marinaded in the lime juice for a few hours. It cooked just fine (I used raw frozen shrimp that I thawed before adding to the lime). I used more hot sauce per our tastes and just added the avocado into the mix. It's amazing. Served with tortilla chips.
very, very delicious!
I added 1/2 cup of scallops to this dish but felt like it was missing more tomatoe and some added spice for the next time trying this. Overall good!
en-cre-dibe-ley

This was a good base but needs modification. I added quite a bit more lime juice and cilantro, as well as garlic salt & lemon pepper, but it was still missing something. Not sure if it makes a difference but I did use half uncooked white shrimp and half precooked lobster tail pieces. Next time I may add some diced jalepeno. Definitely do not serve with saltine crackers. Pairs best with tostadas (or in a pinch, tortilla chips) guests can pile high. Serve with a slotted spoon or there will be too much liquid. Also serve alongside a bottle of Tapatio so everyone can choose their own level of fire. I'm going to play around with this some more as it has the makings of an amazing ceviche! Thanks for posting!
Absolutely devine! I have tried numerous recipes and NONE of them can compare. A+A+A+A+A+A+A+

I made this on New Year's Eve for my husband's family, and they LOVED it! I did a few things differently. I dumped the shrimp in boiling water for a few seconds, and then let it sit in the fresh lime juice overnight. I also added 2 jalapenos (finely diced) and 1 cucumber, chopped. I served this with tostada shells and chopped avocado on the side. This was a hit, and is well over 4 servings! I'm sure I'll be making this very often!

Excellent appetizer. We serve with "scoops" tortilla chips which makes it easier to eat. Also have made the mistake of not chopping the shrimp up enough and it hasn't "cooked" well. 'we let ours marinate in the lime juice overnight.

This was delicious, thank you. It was 10x better the next day too!! I highly recommend making a full day in advance, all the flavors really come together. I didn't make any changes nor do I agree with "rating" a recipe that has had dozens and dozens of changes made :)
This recipe is fantastic!!! I want to make this all the time!!! So so yummy!!!
Amazing!!
I was leary, so I made a batch with cooked shirmp and a batch with uncooked shrimp to take to my cooking club. The recipe that I followed from here with the uncooked shrimp was so good!!!! YUM!
Perfect... I made this without spices and tasted it and it was boring... added the spices and holy it was AMAZING!! This is a keeper!!! Thank you for posting. This is great w/ pita chips and beer. ;)
This was a great recipe and everyone loved it. The bowl was empty. I made it exactly as the recipe states except serving it with tortilla chips.

This is AWESOME! I just had ceviche for the first time at a restaurant last night because I had always been to scared to try it and I fell in love so I was determined to make it at home tonight. This recipe was better than the restaurant! I left out the ketchup and the crackers, but that's all I changed. I used some tomatoes from my garden and some Romas from the store. I will most definitely be making this again, and probably for guests! It's sure to wow people and can be made ahead of time. LOVE THIS - a new summer staple a long as their are tomatoes in the garden.
I added garlic and used red onion instead of white, otherwise followed the recipe exactly. Loved it! A great ceviche recipe.

I read all the reviews and Still decoded to try this exactly as written.... First the shrimp were still totally raw after 20 minutes in the lime juice ( even though I chopped them pretty small). So I decided at that point to just add the tomatoes onion etc and let bit all marinade an hour... After one hour the shrimp were still completely raw! Still grayish blue color and not opaque at all. I kept an eye on it for another hour before we just ordered pizza and decided to try for lunch the next day. Well in the morning the shrimp were opaque finally, whew. And the end result was absolutely delicious! We even had some the next night and it was still great. Served on tostadas with lots of avocado. For sure if I make this again will marinade the shrimp overnight. I don't understand why it didn't work for me as written.

Great ceviche recipe! It tastes very much like I remember eating it in Mexico. I goofed and used parsley I had on hand from another recipe instead of cilantro. Luckily, I could still add cilantro after my error, because the cilantro is like the tie that binds this recipe together. I think this tasted better after it sat in the fridge overnight. At first I thought it seemed a bit too sweet.
Simple & delicious with authentic flavor!

This recipe feeds far more than 4 people if used as one of a few side dishes. We used cocktail sauce instead of ketchup and a lot more of it. In the interest of saving time, I used cooked cocktail shrimp but this method really didn't infuse as much flavor into the shrimp as the "cooking" in lime juice. Definitely get more avacado and cocktail sauce to serve on the side. I prefer tortilla chips on the side over saltines.
This recipe was amazing! I halfed it because there were only 2 of us eating it and I also added cucumbers. Will definitely be making this again!!
VERY GOOD RECIPIE, ADDED TWO SERRANO CHILLIES SEEDS AND ALL FOR A LITTLE MORE SPICE AND A DASH OF CAYENNE PEPPER. BROUGHT IT TO WORK AND IT WAS GOBBLED UP!
Great dish but I like it better without the avocados.
Very good and lots of flavor not too lemony just perfect I added the avocado diced small it was great with tostadas or saltines recipe is a keeper
Good, but not great.

My husband loves shrimp and enjoyed Ceviche when he was in South America. However, he wasn't overly fond of this, thought it was lacking something, and he will eat anything! Since I don't like shrimp much myself I can't really judge. Won't make this again as it sat in my refrigerator and was a waste of shrimpl

The taste of this is 5 star, but I am only giving it 3 becuase something is off in the recipe...it says that your shrimp should "cook" in 5 minutes. Mine took pretty much ALL day. Luckily I started this recipe first thing in the morning. As long as you do that you should be OK! Oh, and instead of mixing the avocado in, I served the ceviche in avocado halves. YUM!
Very very good. Only change I made was to add another avocado. It made a LOT! I shared with friends.
very easy to make and so tasty. helpful hint if you've never diced a tomato (i hadn't)... youtube! :)
After reading the reviews, I decided to use this recipe for a New Year's Eve party. It was so easy to make and was so yummy!! I served mine with tortilla chips and I added chopped jalepeno.

I cut the recipe in half and there was plenty of salsa! I used cooked shrimp and cubed up the avocados and put them in (I liked the pop of color they added). *** Do NOT eat with saltines, it's not as good. They'd be much better with fresh Mexican tortilla chips. Otherwise, everything else was the same. Enjoy!
We love this recipe! Usually when I prepare it I like to add chopped cucumber to it.The cucumber gives it an even more refreshing flavor.

This is a wonderful, easy recipe. I make it for Christmas every year. A few suggestions: To save a lot of time, buy fresh frozen shrimp that have been shelled and deveined. Also, the smaller you chop the shrimp, the faster it will "cook".
